item.title: Fly tipping, 4th October
item.description:
Someone has dumped a small table under the trees, please remove. There is also a large amount of rubbish/debris in this corner following recent storms, please clear the area of plastic and litter. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kendall Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch fallen off tree outside 61 South Hill Road, 4th October
item.description:
A large branch broke on the tree on the pavement directly outside 61 South Road during the evening of the 4th October. It blocked the pavement so we cut it free of the tree and dragged the branch into our front garden. The branch needs removing and the tree might require some appropriate pruning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, South Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected commercial waste bins, 4th October
item.description:
The large commercial waste bins on the corner of Green Lanes and Melbourne Avenue are still uncollected. They str overflowing and the wind is blowing rubbish all over the carriageway on Green Lanes and all the way up Melbourne Avenue generating additional street sweeping work for the Council workers. This is unhealthy, ugly and unpleasant and has been unresolved for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Green Lanes, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree fallen, 4th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rattray Road, Brixton, London

item.title: Tree branches banging into window, 4th October
item.description:
There is a large tree on the sidewalk in feont of our house. The branches bang into our windows when it is windy. I am worried the windows will break. Please trim this tree away from our house at 1 St Mark's Rise (NOT 1A St Marks!)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Marks Rise, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
